thread.title: 'Canes continue working on improving offensive line
thread.title_full: 'Canes continue working on improving offensive line - Sun Sentinel

author: Christy Cabrera Chirinos
title: 'Canes continue working on improving offensive line
text:
Entering the season, one of the biggest question marks facing the Hurricanes was the offensive line.
Five games into the season and after a disappointing 29-24 loss to rival Florida State, it's clear Miami is still trying to address some issues up front.
Though Brad Kaaya was sacked just twice by Florida State's defense, the quarterback was rushed and hit throughout the night, three of his passes on Miami's final drive were batted down and the Hurricanes run game was never able to find any kind of success against FSU's defense.
Miami rushed for just 20 yards — a tally also hindered by sacks — against the Seminoles, with Joe Yearby limited to 33 yards.
Sunday, as the Hurricanes turned their focus to their next game against Virginia Tech, Miami coach Al Golden said reserves Kc McDermott and Joe Brown continue stating their cases for more playing time.
Perhaps no yearly matchup in college football has spawned a greater collection of NFL-caliber talent--certainly over the past three decades--than the annual Miami Hurricanes-Florida State Seminoles game. Here are a collection of the series' standout performances----throughout a game, or even in a crucial moment of a win.
(Steve Svekis) McDermott saw an increase in minutes against FSU, while Brown could see more against the Hokies.
"It gives us more combinations and again, I think we fought hard. We need to do a better job in the running game, but we fought hard," Golden said. "We only gave up two sacks in 49 pass attempts. … you're going to get quarterback hurries and things of that nature, and there's a lot of things we need to improve, but the effort was there. … there's some good things and then there's some things we need to correct, which were pretty evident."
•Golden said receiver Stacy Coley , who hurt his hip after an acrobatic touchdown catch in the fourth quarter, was doing "great" and he doesn't expect the injury to become a long-term issue.
Highlights of the the Miami Hurricanes at Florida State Seminoles at Bobby Bowden Field at Doak Campbell Stadium in Tallahassee, Fla., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, from Sentinel staff photographers Stephen M. Dowell and Joe Burbank.
Golden also said the team will be cautious with defensive tackle Kendrick Norton (ankle sprain) and center Nick Linder (strained trapezius muscle) this week.
Next game: Miami vs. Virginia Tech, 3:30 p.m. Saturday, ESPNU
 Miami Hurricanes
